text: A preacher who set out this month to pray over the entire southern border said his tent revivals, baptisms, and invocations are changing lives. Listen to them on the latest episode of â€œQuick Startâ€ ğŸ‘‡ Pastor Tony Suarezâ€™s [Revival on the Border](https://revivalmakers.com/revival-on-the-border/) already unfolded in El Paso, Texas, from March 21-23, and will arrive in McAllen, Texas, from March 27-29, with nightly revival meetings concluding on Good Friday. Suarez said the first wave of evangelistic outreach in El Paso was remarkable. â€œOur street evangelism team set out to reach everyone, everywhere!â€ the preacher told CBN News. â€œFrom bars to city parks to those we could get to come to the tent â€” when it was all set and done, God gave us a harvest of over 3,000 souls that had an experience with God, in some form or fashion.â€ Prayer is a vital component of the Revival on the Border effort, with Suarez explaining how a â€œprayer armyâ€ was equipped and sent out the last night of the El Paso event. These individuals then journeyed to spaces across the southern border to offer invocations, minister, and hand out resources. â€œStarting in El Paso â€” and in each city theyâ€™ve been to â€” weâ€™ve driven a stake into the ground claiming that city for the Lord,â€ he said. â€œThe prayer army was tasked with speaking the name of Jesus over every single mile of the border between Texas and Mexico, as well as praying in the Spirit, and reaching people along the way.â€ Suarez continued, â€œThese men have handed out Bibles to migrants, border patrol agents [and] they have preached in parks and ministered to people in restaurants.â€ The preacher said dozens have been baptized and experienced healing. But he added, â€œThe greatest miracle of all is people giving their lives to God!â€ Suarez asked people to continue praying for those encountering these revival events through March 29.
